parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.56

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Eden Editor

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set [[Eden_Editor:_Scenario_Atttributes|scenario attributes]].
<br><br>
An attribute is identified by its <tt>property</tt> (<tt>data</tt> when it is engine-drive attribute) value in config. For the list of all attributes with their properties, see [[Eden_Editor:_Setting_Attributes#Scenario|Mission Attributes]].

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Attributes are available only within the Eden Editor workspace. You cannot access them in scenario preview or exported scenario!</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''set3DENMissionAttributes''' <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>[[<section>,<class1>,<value1>], ..., [<section >,<classN>,<valueN>]]</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> section: [[String]] - attribute section
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> class: [[String]] - attribute name
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> value: [[Anything]] - new attribute value
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if the value was set

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[set3DENMissionAttributes]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>[[</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>"Multiplayer","respawn",3],["Multiplayer","respawnDelay",10]];</code>
Set respawn type to 3 and respawn delay to 10 seconds

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> 
[[get3DENMissionAttribute]] [[set3DENMissionAttribute]]
</value></part></template>


<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 2, 2019 - 12:09 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:R3vo|R3vo]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Usually, the attributes value can be recieved by <code>_sectionName [[get3DENMissionAttribute]] _attributeName;//See example above</code>
However, if the attribute was not changed and it is default value is used [[get3DENMissionAttribute]] might return [[Nothing]], even though in [[Eden Editor]] the attribute has got a value. In that case the attribute's config name is not identical to the 'property' or 'data' config value. To get the right values in these cases one has to do:<br>
<code>_sectionName [[get3DENMissionAttribute]] _propertyName;</code> or
<code>_sectionName [[get3DENMissionAttribute]] _dataName;</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
